p: Diagnostic viral load titers were significantly lower in patients who ended up being admitted compared with patients who did not (log10 VL = 3.3 versus 4.0; P = 0.014) ( Figure 1 and Table 2). Multivariate linear regression analysis corroborated these findings, showing that this association is independent of the effect of other confounders, including age, sex, race, comorbidities, and BMI ( P = 0.018) ( Table 2).
